title: Gas-fed photoelectrochemical reactions sustained by phosphotungstic acid as an inorganic surface electrolyte
content:
Energy Adv., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D3YA00568B, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Fumiaki Amano, Keisuke Tsushiro, Chiho Akamoto
Phosphotungstic acid (H3PW12O40) can function as a surface solid electrolyte for porous WO3 photoanode in gas-phase photoelectrochemical reactions such as water vapour splitting and methane conversion in the absence of liquid electrolytes.
